snippet: A highly unscientific survey of its guests yielded plenty of reasons tourists would come to a two-year-old boutique hotel in the borough that still, apparently, strikes fear in the hearts of cabbies.
abstract: Unscientific survey reveals surprisingly high level of customer satisfaction at the two-year-old Opera House Hotel in New York City's South Bronx neighborhood; guests have been pleased to find spacious, accommodating rooms and a gorgeous Beaux-Arts building in neighborhood that is still trying to shed its notoriety.
lead_paragraph: A highly unscientific survey of its guests yielded plenty of reasons tourists would come to a two-year-old boutique hotel in the borough that still, apparently, strikes fear in the hearts of cabbies.

headline.main: Opera House Hotel in the Bronx Gets High Marks From Guests, if They Can Get There
headline.print_headline: A Hotel in the Bronx Gets High Marks From Guests, if They Can Get There
